Class InventoryService

java.lang.Object
edu.tamu.csce331.sharetea.database.InventoryService
public class InventoryService extends Object
Service class for managing inventory-related database operations in the Sharetea POS system.

This service provides comprehensive functionality for inventory management, including item tracking, quantity monitoring, reorder point management, and transaction logging. It handles the complete inventory lifecycle from procurement to consumption tracking.

Key features include:

  • Inventory item CRUD operations
  • Quantity tracking and updates
  • Reorder point monitoring
  • Transaction history logging
  • Automatic sequence management
  • Soft delete functionality for data integrity

The service handles multiple database tables:

  • inventory_items - Main inventory item records
  • inventory_transactions - Transaction history and audit trail

This service supports various inventory management scenarios:

  • Receiving new inventory shipments
  • Tracking consumption and usage
  • Monitoring reorder points
  • Maintaining audit trails
  • Generating inventory reports
Since:
1.0
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • getAllInventoryItems

      public List<InventoryItem> getAllInventoryItems()
      Retrieves all inventory items from the database.

      This method returns a comprehensive list of all inventory items in the system, including their current quantities, reorder points, cost information, and other relevant details. Items are ordered alphabetically by name for consistent presentation.

      This method is typically used for:

      • Inventory management interfaces
      • Generating complete inventory reports
      • Administrative oversight and auditing
      Returns:
      a List of InventoryItem objects containing all inventory items, ordered by name. Returns an empty list if no items exist or if a database error occurs.
      See Also:
      • for items requiring attention
      • for retrieving specific items

    • getItemsNeedingReorder

      public List<InventoryItem> getItemsNeedingReorder()
      Identifies inventory items that require reordering based on current stock levels.

      This method performs a critical inventory management function by identifying items where the current on-hand quantity is at or below the reorder point. Items are ordered by urgency (most critical first) to help prioritize procurement activities.

      The urgency calculation is based on how far below the reorder point each item has fallen, with items furthest below their reorder point appearing first in the results.

      This method is essential for:

      • Automated reorder alerts and notifications
      • Procurement planning and scheduling
      • Inventory shortage prevention
      • Supply chain management
      Returns:
      a List of InventoryItem objects that are at or below their reorder points, ordered by urgency (most critical first). Returns an empty list if all items are adequately stocked or if a database error occurs.
      See Also:
      • for complete inventory overview
      • for stock updates

    • addInventoryItem

      public boolean addInventoryItem(InventoryItem item)
      Adds a new inventory item to the database with automatic ID generation.

      This method creates a new inventory item record with comprehensive tracking capabilities. The method handles PostgreSQL sequence synchronization to prevent duplicate key errors and ensures proper ID generation for the new inventory item.

      The new inventory item will include:

      • SKU (Stock Keeping Unit) identifier
      • Item name and unit of measurement
      • Initial on-hand quantity
      • Servings per unit calculation
      • Reorder point threshold
      • Cost per unit for financial tracking

      This method will throw a RuntimeException if the database operation fails, which should be handled by the calling code.

      Parameters:
      item - the InventoryItem object containing the item data to be added. Must not be null and should have valid SKU, name, and quantity information.
      Returns:
      true if the inventory item was successfully added to the database, false otherwise
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if a database error occurs during the operation
      See Also:
      • for modifying existing items
      • for removing items

    • updateInventoryItem

      public boolean updateInventoryItem(InventoryItem item)
      Updates an existing inventory item with new information.

      This method modifies the properties of an existing inventory item record based on the provided InventoryItem object. The update is performed using the item's ID to identify the correct record and can modify all fields including quantities, costs, and thresholds.

      Fields that can be updated include:

      • SKU and item name
      • Unit of measurement
      • On-hand quantity
      • Servings per unit
      • Reorder point threshold
      • Cost per unit

      This method will throw a RuntimeException if the database operation fails, which should be handled by the calling code.

      Parameters:
      item - the InventoryItem object containing the updated data. Must not be null and must have a valid inventoryItemId.
      Returns:
      true if the inventory item was successfully updated in the database, false if no rows were affected (item not found)
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if a database error occurs during the operation
      See Also:
      • for creating new items
      • for retrieving items before updating

    • deleteInventoryItem

      public boolean deleteInventoryItem(Long inventoryItemId)
      Deletes an inventory item using soft delete or hard delete based on constraints.

      This method attempts to perform a hard delete first by removing the inventory item record from the database. If the hard delete fails due to foreign key constraints (e.g., the item is referenced in existing transactions), the method automatically falls back to a soft delete by setting the on-hand quantity to zero.

      The soft delete approach ensures data integrity while effectively removing the item from active inventory management. This is particularly important for maintaining historical transaction data and audit trails.

      This method is useful for:

      • Discontinuing inventory items
      • Removing obsolete or expired items
      • Maintaining data integrity in related tables
      Parameters:
      inventoryItemId - the unique identifier of the inventory item to delete
      Returns:
      true if the inventory item was successfully deleted (either hard delete or soft delete), false if the operation failed
      See Also:
      • for modifying items instead of deleting
      • for retrieving items before deletion

    • getInventoryItemById

      public InventoryItem getInventoryItemById(Long inventoryItemId)
      Retrieves a specific inventory item by its unique identifier.

      This method performs a database lookup to find an inventory item with the specified ID. The method returns the complete InventoryItem object including all its properties, quantities, costs, and tracking information.

      This method is useful for:

      • Retrieving item details for editing
      • Validating item existence before operations
      • Displaying detailed item information
      • Performing inventory calculations
      Parameters:
      inventoryItemId - the unique identifier of the inventory item to retrieve
      Returns:
      an InventoryItem object if found, null if no item exists with the specified ID or if a database error occurs
      See Also:
      • for retrieving multiple items
      • for items requiring attention

    • updateInventoryQuantity

      public boolean updateInventoryQuantity(Long inventoryItemId, BigDecimal newQuantity, String reason, Long performedBy)
      Updates the quantity of an inventory item and records the transaction.

      This method performs a comprehensive inventory update that includes both quantity modification and transaction logging. It updates the on-hand quantity to the new value and automatically records the change in the inventory transaction history for audit purposes.

      The method handles various inventory scenarios:

      • Receiving new shipments (positive quantity changes)
      • Consumption tracking (negative quantity changes)
      • Inventory adjustments and corrections
      • Waste and spoilage tracking

      The transaction record includes:

      • Item identification
      • Quantity change amount
      • Reason for the change
      • User who performed the change
      • Timestamp of the transaction
      Parameters:
      inventoryItemId - the unique identifier of the inventory item to update
      newQuantity - the new on-hand quantity for the item
      reason - the reason for the quantity change (e.g., "Received shipment", "Used in production")
      performedBy - the user ID of the person performing the update
      Returns:
      true if the quantity was successfully updated and transaction recorded, false if the operation failed
      See Also:
      • for transaction details
      • for retrieving current item information
